questions.title: What is a hackathon?
questions.answer: A hackathon is an event where students with common interests from all over the nation come together and collaborate on a project over a 24-hour period.

questions.title: Who can come?
questions.answer: All college students (both graduate and undergraduate) are welcome! No prior experience is necessary.

questions.title: What can I build?
questions.answer: If you can think it, you can build it. We encourage students to build technological projects, whether they be software or hardware.

questions.title: What if I don't have a team or idea?
questions.answer: Not a problem. There will be time to find other students who don't have a team yet!

questions.title: Still have questions?
questions.answer: Feel free to shoot us an email at team@slohacks.com or contact us on Facebook!

questions.title: What should I bring?
questions.answer: Bring your ID, computer, and sleeping bag (optional). All the necessary equipment for hardware projects will be provided.

questions.title: How much does it cost?
questions.answer: Food and admission are absolutely FREE! Commute will be free for students traveling within California.

questions.title: Is there a code of conduct?
questions.answer: Please refer to the MLH website.

questions.title: What should I bring?
questions.answer: We will be reimbursing hackers for their transportation within California. Check your email upon acceptance for more details!

questions.title: What should I bring?
questions.answer: Feel free to shoot us an email at team@slohacks.com or contact us on Facebook.
